findings.title: DAO_Role vote verification
findings.description: One single user with DAO_Role permission can repeatedly vote to reach the threshold by calling the signCarTransaction function and the signHash function, causing a serious permission security issue.

findings.title: Function parameter pass-in security
findings.description: When an user calls the lockTokenPayment function, he can structure the parameters to bypass the “require” judgement in the contract and execute the function. This will cause exceptions when voting for transaction.

findings.title: LockFee Fee Calculation
findings.description: The project party will fail to withdraw the storage fee for the specified dealld while the user does not transfer enough amount or the FIL price has significant floating in a short period of time.

findings.title: Vulnerability of Refund Function
findings.description: The project party will fail to withdraw the storage fee while the user withdraws the storage fee advance, in the case that user has submitted the storage request and the Dao_Role has finished vote processing.

findings.title: Data source information acquisition
findings.description: The project party might encounter data source security issues in data pragmaticality, data security and data accuracy due to using HTTP protocol to fetch external data.

findings.title: Out of gas
findings.description: When DAO_Role calls sign to vote, if the incoming cidList is too long, it will cause insufficient gas.
